<xsd:schema targetNamespace="http://soa.estrellaroja.com.mx/EstrellaRojaCommons" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="http://soa.estrellaroja.com.mx/EstrellaRojaCommons"> <xsd:element name="Error" type="ErrorType"/> <xsd:complexType name="MetadataType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="CallerSystem" type="CallerSystemType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifying values for the caller system. The ID may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Environment" type="EnvironmentType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Elements for identifying environment of the service operation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="UserInformation" minOccurs="0" type="UserInformationType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>User information to help recognize who call or execute the service.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="AdditionalInformation" type="AdditionalInformationType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="UserInformationType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="UserId" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Used to identify the source of the caller user by ID or code.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="UserName" minOccurs="0" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Used to identify the source of the caller user by name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="EmptyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Setting an empty element of this type indicates no values or elements are needed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SuccessType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Returning an empty element of this type indicates the successful processing of a message</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ErrorsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">A collection of errors that occurred during the processing of a message.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Error" type="ErrorType" maxOccurs="99" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">An error that occurred during the processing of a message.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ErrorType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">Standard way to indicate that an error occurred during the Web Service processing. If the message successfully processes, but there are business errors, those errors should be passed in the warning element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ErrorCode" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Error element MUST contain the Type that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the error type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ShortDescription" type="xsd:string"/> <xsd:element name="Description" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of the error.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="BusinessProcess" type="xsd:string"/> <xsd:element name="FailedService" type="xsd:string"/> <xsd:element name="TimeStamp" type="xsd:string"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CallerSystemType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="SystemId" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Used to identify the source of the caller System by ID or code.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="SystemName" type="xsd:string" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Used to identify the source of the caller System by name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="EnvironmentType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Context" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xsd:element name="ProccesName" type="xsd:string" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Generally the operation name or business name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="AdditionalInformationType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="CompanyName" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies a company by code or name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TransactionId" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TimeStamp" type="xsd:dateTime" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates the creation date and time of the message in UTC using the following format specified by ISO 8601; YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ with time values using the 24 hour clock (e.g. 01 December 2016, 1:59:38 pm UTC becomes 2016-12-01T13:59:38Z).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="BaseRsType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Success" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="SuccessType"/> <xsd:element name="Errors" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0" type="ErrorsType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:schema>
